paper_title.ja: チャベス政権支持増減の要因としてのマクロ経済と再分配政策──世界資本主義の中のラテンアメリカ政治への含意の視角から
協同セルフヘルプ型 (「クラブ財型」) 集合行為におけるコミットメントと忠誠:―ラテンアメリカの事例から―
paper_title.en: Commitment and Loyalty in Collective Self-Help Social Movements::A Proto-Model of "Club-Good Collective Action" and Some Latin American Cases

description.ja: We can hypothetically formulate a model to analyze a category of collective action that may be called "collective self-help social movements." The thesis of "collective action problem" that M. Olson posits for collective actions that produce public goods does not apply to that category of actions, because the goods they produce are "club goods," which are characterized by excludability (and nonrivalrousness). However, the cost of administrating and managing collective action (that corresponds to "second-order free-rider problem" for collective actions that produce public goods) tends to be remarkably higher than that of "first-order" activities that produce club goods themselves in those collective actions, and it tends to be covered by a limited number of members that form the leadership, who are characterized by "irrational" commitment and loyalty to the causes, ideologies, or goals of the movements they lead, and/or to the groups to which they suppose that they belong to (or, identities). We can hypothesize that that kind of collective actions tend to succeed where two conditions exist: where (1) there are committed or loyal leaders, and (2) the benefit from participating in those actions (the utility of the club goods produced by those actions) is high for a substantial part of the population. It is shown that Hirschmans findings on social movements for grassroots development in Latin America can be re-interpreted by that hypothesis and that the rise and fall of the "barter club" movements in Argentina can be interpreted (if not explained) by the same hypothesis. We might suppose that plausibility of the hypothesis presented in this essay would show that "irrational" elements play a substantial role in politics.
description.en: We can hypothetically formulate a model to analyze a category of collective action that may be called "collective self-help social movements." The thesis of "collective action problem" that M. Olson posits for collective actions that produce public goods does not apply to that category of actions, because the goods they produce are "club goods," which are characterized by excludability (and nonrivalrousness). However, the cost of administrating and managing collective action (that corresponds to "second-order free-rider problem" for collective actions that produce public goods) tends to be remarkably higher than that of "first-order" activities that produce club goods themselves in those collective actions, and it tends to be covered by a limited number of members that form the leadership, who are characterized by "irrational" commitment and loyalty to the causes, ideologies, or goals of the movements they lead, and/or to the groups to which they suppose that they belong to (or, identities). We can hypothesize that that kind of collective actions tend to succeed where two conditions exist: where (1) there are committed or loyal leaders, and (2) the benefit from participating in those actions (the utility of the club goods produced by those actions) is high for a substantial part of the population. It is shown that Hirschmans findings on social movements for grassroots development in Latin America can be re-interpreted by that hypothesis and that the rise and fall of the "barter club" movements in Argentina can be interpreted (if not explained) by the same hypothesis. We might suppose that plausibility of the hypothesis presented in this essay would show that "irrational" elements play a substantial role in politics.

description.en: 1980年代の「民主化の時代」に「民主主義」が成立したラテンアメリカ諸国において、その「民主主義」が維持される傾向が支配的である理由を、政治と経済のあり方の解明を通して明らかにしようとした。

paper_title.ja: 官僚的権威主義・ファシズム・国家安全保障国家 －南米南部の軍政の性格付けをめぐって（二）
paper_title.en: 官僚的権威主義・ファシズム・国家安全保障国家 －南米南部の軍政の性格付けをめぐって（二）

description.en: 南米南部諸国に1960年代と70年代に登場した長期軍政についての様々な概念と、それぞれが説く原因論を検討し、その欠点を明らかにする形で、上記軍政の理解を深めようとした。
description.ja: 南米南部諸国に1960年代と70年代に登場した長期軍政についての様々な概念と、それぞれが説く原因論を検討し、その欠点を明らかにする形で、上記軍政の理解を深めようとした。

paper_title.ja: 新保守主義的軍政における抵抗運動に関する予備的考察 －アルゼンチンの「五月広場の母達」

description.en: アルゼンチンにおける1976－83年の極度に抑圧的な軍政に対して、その抑圧の犠牲となった人々の母親達が行った社会運動の性格を考えることにより、その軍政の性格の一面を明らかにしようとした。
description.ja: アルゼンチンにおける1976－83年の極度に抑圧的な軍政に対して、その抑圧の犠牲となった人々の母親達が行った社会運動の性格を考えることにより、その軍政の性格の一面を明らかにしようとした。

description.en: 南米南部諸国に1960年代と70年代に登場した長期軍政についての様々な概念と、それぞれが説く原因論を検討し、その欠点を明らかにする形で、上記軍政の理解を深めようとした。

paper_title.ja: 政軍関係をめぐるふたつの議論の批判的検討 －ファイナーとムーゼリス
paper_title.en: 政軍関係をめぐるふたつの議論の批判的検討 －ファイナーとムーゼリス

description.en: 政軍関係一般に関するファイナーの議論を検討し、歴史的コンテクスト文脈の重要性を確認したのち、南米南部のコンテクストでの政治発展を扱し、軍政登場の原因についての解釈を示したムーゼリスの議論を批判的に検討し、異なる解釈を仮説的に示した。
description.ja: 政軍関係一般に関するファイナーの議論を検討し、歴史的コンテクスト文脈の重要性を確認したのち、南米南部のコンテクストでの政治発展を扱し、軍政登場の原因についての解釈を示したムーゼリスの議論を批判的に検討し、異なる解釈を仮説的に示した。
